roleset.name: break, breaking (up), terminating
roleset.note: BUST-V NOTES: Inchoative need not include the pieces argument. (from bust.01-v)
BUSTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, bust-v.01. No corresponding VNcls. (from busting.01-n)
BUST-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from bust.01-n)

example.name: with predicate
example.text: Toshiba Corp. busted open that sector this summer with a notebook-sized machine that retails for less than 200,000 yen (under $1,500) -- one of the smallest, cheapest PCs available in the country.
example.arg: with a notebook-sized machine that retails for less than 200,000 yen (under $1,500) -- one of the smallest, cheapest PCs available in the country

example.name: inchoative
example.text: The window busted into a million pieces.

example.name: metaphorical busting
example.text: Union - busting in Ohio was voted down by a large margin , trying to make it harder for Democratic - leaning voters in Maine was defeated , the attempt to ban all abortions and most forms of birth control in Mississippi was sunk , and the radical right - winger state Senator who wrote the aggressive anti-immigrant bill in Arizona was recalled .

example.name: Physical injury
example.text: His coaches at Iowa recall his busting the shoulder of a running back with a tackle during a developmental scrimmage when he was a sophomore.
example.arg: the shoulder of a running back
during a developmental scrimmage when he was a sophomore

roleset.name: fizzle, fail
roleset.note: BUST-N NOTES: Comparison to boom.01 (from bust.06-n)

example.name: arg0
example.text: The private sector can do pretty much whatever it wants but the state must be able to support itself with or without the boom and bust of the private sector .

roleset.name: catch a criminal
roleset.note: BUST-V NOTES: Frames file for 'bust' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, Framenet entry Escaping (as phrasal bust out). (from bust.02-v predicate notes)
BUST-N NOTES: Added by Julia for BOLT. (from bust.02-n)

example.name: good cop/bad cop
example.text: John busted a notorious ring of jelly-bean smugglers.
example.arg: a notorious ring of jelly-bean smugglers

example.name: arg2
example.text: The ex-sheriff in my town used to drive around in a fancy Cadillac seized in a drug bust .

roleset.name: catch ghosts
roleset.note: BUST-V NOTES: This sense is an unfortunate relic of one particular article in theTreebank, and will probably never occur again. (from bust.05-v)

example.name: who ya gonna call?
example.text: [They]-1 claim *trace*-1 to have busted spirits, poltergeists and other spooks in hundreds of houses around the country.
example.arg: in hundreds of houses around the country

example.name: not quite Alcatraz
example.text: John busted out of Mary's basement.

example.name: smithereens
example.text: John busted up Mary's dining room table.
